page.title: 03CROP CHANGES NEAR BRECHIN
page.content: In recent years agricultural land-use has seen the upsurge of several new crops including oil seed rape,peas and flax.These are slowly replacing the more traditional crops such as turnips,grass and soft fruits although flax was previously grown in the district until the mid 19th century. This year Broomfield farm has 15 acres of flax with an expected yield of 1.5 tons per acre.This will be sold to Tayside Flax in Arbroath for linen production.The farmer has also sown a field of peas to use as cattle fodder. Several farms in the block have oil seed rape.This crop gives a very distinctive yellow colouring to the landscape in early summer.The crop is harvested by contractors using specialised machinery and sold to margarine companies.
